answers.answer: The only one of your meds that I am familiar with is metformin.  It is generally used for type II diabetes, but maybe you have some insulin resistance or pre-diabetes, which could also make it difficult, if not impossible, to lose weight.  That may be why you were prescribed that.  It is also used to treat PCOS - do you know if you have that?  Is that why your cycle is irregular?Did you have other thyroid tests done (Free T-4, Free T-3, etc)?  I'm sure there will be others who can tell you more about the other meds.  If you have other thyroid test results, you might want to post them, along with the lab ranges.

my previous blood test says,T3, Total= 1.28 ng/mL  [0.60 - 1.81]T4, Total= 8.20 ug/dL  [5.60 - 13.70]TSH= 2.77 uIu/mL  [0.35 - 5.50]But the next time the doctor had only TSH check up which was 2.020 uIu/mL

question: Hi all,I am from India. I was diagnosed thyroid in june... at that time my TSH was 2.77 and i am having medication. I am also trying to concieve for our first baby.Last month when i had blood test it showed that my TSH level is 2.020 Now i want to ask a few questions regarding the medicines..I am having the following medicines:Thyronorm 25MgcGold Care,Loprin-75,E-codM2 Tone,Gluconorm SR 1g [Metaformin salt]DemisonI want to know are these medicines alright. and is Metaformin SR 1g is ok to intake as someone told me that it is for diabities patient and for weight loss. and it is given to me maily for weight loss?The symptoms of my thyroid are. Weight gain, Hair loss, Irregular MC cycle....
title: about the thyroid medicines
